summary: We audit the U.S. government's consolidated financial statements annually. Ongoing problems prevent us from determining whether the statements fairly present the government's finances. Treasury has made significant progress in addressing some of the issues we've found in the preparation processes—including the review of selected treaties and other international agreements. But additional actions are needed to address our prior recommendations. Our 5 new recommendations address remaining...
title: U.S. Consolidated Financial Statements: Improvements Needed in Internal Controls over Treasury and OMB Preparation Processes
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
